page.title: 03INSKIP
page.content: Inskip is a small village about eight miles from Preston,eleven miles from Blackpool and eighteen miles from Lancaster.The registered population is 553.There are six people on the parish council they are elected every three years.The chairman stands for one year.The council meets every month to discuss village affairs. There is a C of E primary school, an Anglican church, a Baptist chapel, a post office and a pub.There is a naval base which received important information during the Falklands war. A playgroup, disco's, youth clubs and keep fit are held at the camp. Originally Inskip was a farming community but recently several new housing estates have been built.Also a children's playground, football ground and a bowling green. When the farmers retire the land is let to neighbouring farms.
